content: end on row 13 on row 16 you will slip the thumb sts onto a yarn holder and cast on 2 stitches using the backward loop method to keep the pattern correct you will make two decreases over the cast on stitches in the next row make all increases for the thumb gusset in dark yarn this makes them blend in with the check pattern carry the dark colour on top / above / ahead and the light colour under / below / behind the hand is knit in 2x2 check the thumb is knit in 1x1 check begin the hand chart with two dark stitches follow with two light stitches and continue the pattern to the end of the row knit the next row the same and then change the first two stitches to light followed by two in dark the chart shows how the thumb sits in the colour sequence the checked pattern continues beyond the thumb to the last two row of the mitten this is a free pattern that i made up to knit mittens for sale at a craft fair you are welcome to sell any mittens you make from this pattern i d love to see your mittens if you need any help have any questions or find mistakes in this pattern please pm me here on ravelry pattern cast on 36 sts on 4mm needles using your preferred method 12 stitches on each needle join to knit in the round place a marker for the bor even if you do not usually mark the bor i find it helps to do so with this pattern especially after you take off the thumb when it can get a bit mesmerizing knit 15 row of k1 p1 rib stripe pattern 5 row dark 2 light 1 dark 2 light 5 dark next row change to 4 5mms knit in straight stitch in dark and increase evenly by five knit two row even continue to knit as established following each increase row with two even row keep the colour sequence correct knitting 1x1 checks for the thumb increase to 11 thumb stitches and
